content: What ancient civilization built the Machu Picchu estate around 1450 but abandoned it a century later during the Spanish Conquest?

Machu Picchu, the breathtaking estate nestled high in the Andes Mountains, was constructed around 1450 by the Inca civilization. This architectural marvel was astonishingly abandoned just a century later during the Spanish Conquest, which swept across the Americas in the 16th century. The Incas, one of the most remarkable civilizations in human history, left behind a legacy that continues to captivate and intrigue scholars and tourists alike. The story of Machu Picchu is a testament to their engineering prowess and their profound connection to the natural world, even as it stands as a silent witness to the tumultuous period of conquest and colonization.
